solution_line_template: If everyone wore life jackets, only {capacity_no_jackets}-{fewer_with_jackets}=<<{capacity_no_jackets}-{fewer_with_jackets}={capacity_with_all_jackets}>>{capacity_with_all_jackets} people could fit on the raft.

For every person less on the raft, {capacity_with_all_jackets}/{fewer_with_jackets}=<<{capacity_with_all_jackets}/{fewer_with_jackets}={jackets_per_person_reduction}>>{jackets_per_person_reduction} life jackets could fit.

For {jackets_needed} life jackets, {jackets_needed}/{jackets_per_person_reduction}=<<{jackets_needed}/{jackets_per_person_reduction}={reduction_for_specific_jackets}>>{reduction_for_specific_jackets} less people could fit.
{capacity_no_jackets}-{reduction_for_specific_jackets}=<<{capacity_no_jackets}-{reduction_for_specific_jackets}={final_capacity}>>{final_capacity} people could fit on the raft.
